parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math - Geometry

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns objects intersecting with the virtual line from ''begPos'' to ''endPos''. By default resulting array of intersecting objects is unsorted. To sort by distance set ''sortByDistance'' param to [[true]]. <br><br><template><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Doesn't work under water. Max hardcoded distance is 1000m.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''lineIntersectsWith''' [begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2, sortByDistance]
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2, sortByDistance]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> begPos: [[PositionASL]] - virtual line start
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> endPos: [[PositionASL]] - virtual line end
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> objIgnore1: (optional) [[Object]] - object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object.
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> objIgnore2: (optional) [[Object]] - another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> sortByDistance: (optional) [[Boolean]] - [[true]]: Sort by distance =&gt; furthermost object first, closest object last; [[false]]: unsorted

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - intersecting objects

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[AGLtoASL]] [[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Sort by distance: <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[AGLtoASL]] [[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5], [[objNull]], [[objNull]], [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Ignore objects: <code>_objects = [[lineIntersectsWith]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[eyePos]] [[player]], [[aimPos]] chopper, [[player]], chopper];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[lineIntersectsSurfaces]], [[lineIntersectsObjs]], [[intersect]], [[terrainIntersect]], [[terrainIntersectASL]], [[terrainIntersectAtASL]], [[lineIntersects]], [[cursorObject]], [[cursorTarget]], [[checkVisibility]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on may 31, 2012 - 10:50 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Please note the difference :
*terrainIntersect
*terrainIntersectASL
*lineIntersect'''''s'''''
*lineIntersect'''''s'''''With
*lineIntersect'''''s'''''Objs 
*intersect

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
